meanings.definition: The state or quality of being longsome; tediousness or wearisomeness.
meanings.sent1: The longsomeness of waiting in line for hours made everyone tired.
meanings.sent2: The longsomeness of the rainy day made the children feel bored.
meanings.sent3: The longsomeness of the math class was like watching paint dry.
meanings.sent4: The longsomeness of the journey felt like walking through molasses.
meanings.sent5: The longsomeness of the movie made it seem like it would never end.

meanings.definition: A feeling of sadness or melancholy due to prolonged separation or loneliness.
meanings.sent1: The longsomeness of missing her best friend was hard to bear.
meanings.sent2: The longsomeness of being far from home weighed heavily on him.
meanings.sent3: The longsomeness of the empty house echoed with loneliness.
meanings.sent4: The longsomeness of the night sky mirrored his sense of isolation.
meanings.sent5: The longsomeness of the quiet room intensified her sense of longing.
